nav.div: North Collins Central School District » District » About » Letter from the Superintendent » COVID19 Update

div.span:
With the rapidly-changing COVID19 situation, we wanted to create a single point of contact for information that we are disseminating to our district families. Check the information below for letters that have been sent to all parents/guardians in our district, as well as links to other resources that may help you manage this situation.
As always, we are available to answer your questions by contacting me personally, or the Main Office of the school your child attends. Thank you for your patience as we work toward a solution that best serves our students, parents and the community.

input.name: ctl00$ContentPlaceHolder1$ctl16$hfCanUseMultiSelect

div.style: float: right; position: absolute; display: none

div.p: North Collins Central School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, or disability in admission to its programs, services, or activities, in access to them, in treatment of individuals, or in any aspect of their operations. The lack of English language skills shall not be a barrier to admission or participation in the district's activities and programs. North Collins Central School District also does not discriminate in its hiring or employment practices.
